etymologies: early 19th century: from Hindi ghaṛiyāl. The spelling gavial (from French) is an alteration probably due to scribal error

definitions: a large fish-eating crocodile with a long, narrow snout that widens at the nostrils, native to the Indian subcontinent.

notes.text: Gavialis gangeticus, the only member of the family Gavialidae

shortDefinitions: large fish-eating crocodile with long, narrow snout that widens at nostrils
